subsection.heading: Federal Charter.—
subsection.content: American War Mothers (in this chapter, the “corporation”) is a federally chartered corporation.

subsection.heading: Place of Incorporation.—
subsection.content: The corporation is declared to be incorporated in the District of Columbia.

subsection.heading: Period of Existence.—
subsection.content: The corporation may continue to exist until there are no individuals who qualify for membership.

section.heading: Purposes
section.chapeau: The purposes of the corporation are—

paragraph.content: to keep alive and develop the spirit that promoted world service;
to maintain the ties of fellowship born of that service and to assist and further any patriotic work;
to inculcate a sense of individual obligation to the community, State, and Nation;
to work for the welfare of the Army and Navy;
to assist, in any way in their power, men and women who served and were wounded or incapacitated in World War I; and
to foster and promote friendship and understanding between America and the Allies in World War I.

section.heading: Membership
section.chapeau: Eligibility for membership in the corporation is limited to women—

paragraph.content: who are citizens of the United States; and

paragraph.chapeau: whose natural son or daughter, legally adopted son or daughter, or stepson or stepdaughter—

subparagraph.content: served in the Armed Forces of the United States or its allies in World War I, World War II, the Korean conflict, or any subsequent war or conflict involving the United States; and
was honorably discharged from that service or continues in the service.

paragraph.content: adopt a constitution, bylaws, and regulations;
adopt and alter a corporate seal;
establish and maintain offices to conduct its activities;
establish State, territorial, and local subdivisions;
acquire, own, lease, encumber, and transfer property as necessary to carry out the purposes of the corporation, subject to section 22506(b) of this title;
publish a magazine and other publications;
do any other act necessary and proper to carry out its purposes.

content.p: The corporation and its State, territorial, and local subdivisions have the exclusive right to use the name “American War Mothers”.

subsection.heading: General.—
subsection.content: The corporation shall be nonprofit, nonpolitical, nonsectarian, and nonpartisan, and may not promote the candidacy of an individual seeking public office.

subsection.heading: Ownership and Use of Property.—
subsection.content: The corporation may not accept, own, or hold, directly or indirectly, any property not reasonably necessary to carry out the purposes of the corporation.

content.p: The personal property and funds of the corporation, whether principal or income, so long as held or used only to carry out the purposes of the corporation, are exempt from taxation by the United States Government, the District of Columbia, and the territories and possessions of the United States.
The corporation may hold its meetings at any place the corporation decides.

As a condition to the exercise of any power or privilege granted by this chapter, the corporation shall file, with the secretary of state or other designated official of each State, the name and address of an agent in that State on whom legal process or demands against the corporation may be served.

Not later than January 1 of each year, the corporation shall submit a report to Congress on the activities of the corporation during the prior calendar year. The report may not be printed as a public document.
